title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Wednesday, 30 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: a campaign has been launched to save an ancient stone in soulbury , near leighton buzzard , after a driver backed into it .
about 1,000 people are expected to demonstrate in high wycombe in buckinghamshire in april .
a teenage boy has died after his motorcycle hit a lamppost in luton .
more news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from the live team today .
we 'll be back with you again from 08:00 tomorrow with the latest news , sport , weather and travel for beds , herts and bucks .
if you missed anything , why not take a scroll through the page ?
and if you 'd like to get in touch at all , you can email here .

documents.title: new air ambulance for first time in 20 years
text: charity fundraisers in hertfordshire are being praised , after the essex and herts air ambulance trust announced it would be buying its own helicopter for the first time in its 20 year history .
the £ 6m helicopter will start flying in june next year .
as well as donations from the public and businesses , the charity successfully bid for £ 1.5m from the government 's libor fund .

documents.title: weather : sunny spells but risk of showers
text: there will be some sunny spells to end the day but it will turn a little cloudy with the risk of a shower this evening .
lows of 0c ( 32f ) .
there will be a cold start tomorrow with a touch of frost in places .
highs of 12c ( 53f ) .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: tools and number plates stolen from south oxhey vehicles
text: power tools and number plates were stolen from several vehicles in south oxhey last night .
police are appealing for information after the tools were stolen from ford transit vans in raglan gardens , ashburnham drive and oaklands avenue .
three males were seen in the raglan gardens area (
number plates were stolen from two vehicles on hillcroft crescent and greenfield avenue , police say .

documents.title: bletchley store ram raided by gang
text: a store in bletchley has spoken to onemk after more than £ 10,000 worth of damage was caused in an unsuccessful ram raid .
author: One MK

documents.title: weather watchers or wildlife watchers ?
text: it 's not all of sunshine and clouds coming into our weather watchers inbox
we also receive delightful photographs of wildlife like this cheeky-looking squirrel in bedford .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: afternoon headlines : high wycombe demonstrations luton teen killed in crash
text: the headlines :

documents.title: man freed from car after bus crash in princes risborough
text: a car and a bus collided in princes risborough earlier this afternoon .
emergency services were called to the scene in bell street just before 14:15 .
the fire service released a man from the car , who was injured .
all bus passengers were checked over by ambulance staff .
latest incident : collision between bus and car in bell street , princes risborough .
all passengers off bus and checked over by @ twitterid

documents.title: the legend of the soulbury stone
text: an ancient stone in soulbury , near leighton buzzard , will stay put despite a driver threatening legal action after damaging her car backing into it .
people told us about the legend of the stone
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: m1 overnight closures continue
text: luton airport is reminding passengers travelling by road of the m1 overnight closures that may affect journey times .
the closures began two weeks ago and continue until 9 april as 40 giant steel bridge beams are lifted into place for the new j11a .
driving to the airport tonight ?
m1 carriageway closures overnight 10pm - 6am may affect your journey , visit for info

documents.title: high wycombe police prepare for demonstrations
text: about 1,000 people are expected to demonstrate in high wycombe in buckinghamshire on saturday , 9 april .
thames valley police have been advised there will be about 200 from the far-right english defence league and a counter demonstration of about 800 people .
supt ed mclean , the district commander for wycombe , says the `` police are here to allow a lawful and peaceful protest '' and `` will do our very best '' to ensure it is a safe day for everyone .
author: Toby Friedner
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: woman hit with metal pole in biggleswade attack
text: a woman was struck over the head by what 's believed to have been a metal pole in an attack in biggleswade on good friday .
the woman was walking along an alleyway near biggleswade train station between 05:30 and 06:00 when she was hit from behind .
police say it 's `` vital '' they find the offender , who is described as a female of stocky build with long dark hair .

documents.title: hitchin property 'closed ' by police
text: a closure order has been placed on an address in hitchin following complaints about suspected drug taking .
the property , in desborough road , was investigated by the police after lresidents complained about anti-social behaviour .
police , north herts homes and north herts district council received complaints from neighbours about loud music , arguments and suspected drug dealing .
the order prevents anyone from entering the property for three months .

documents.title: luton playwright up for three baftas
text: luton author and playwright jack thorne has been nominated for three bafta tv awards .
author: Luton News

documents.title: tributes to luton teen who died in motorbike crash
text: tributes are being left for a teenage boy who died after his motorcycle hit a lamppost in luton yesterday .
bedfordshire police said the boy died in hospital following a collision on a pavement outside whitefield primary school in the marsh farm estate .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : collision on m25 in hertfordshire
text: there 's a lane closed on the m25 anti-clockwise in hertfordshire just before j23 due to a collision .
traffic is queuing to j24 .
check your journey here .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: cps 'right ' not to charge officers over jean charles de menezes death
text: the european court of human rights has ruled british prosecutors were right not to charge police officers involved in the shooting of a brazilian electrician they suspected was a suicide bomber .
jean charles de menezes was shot seven times in the head by specialist firearms officers as he boarded an underground train at stockwell station in south london on july 22 , 2005 .
the chief constable of bedfordshire police , jon boucher , was a detective superintendent on the case that day .

documents.title: weather watchers : sunshine in chalfont st giles
text: it looks like the ducks were out enjoying the sunshine in chalfont st giles this morning - perhaps later they 'll be enjoying the rain that 's forecast ?
if you 'd like to share your images of what the weather 's like where you are , you can sign up to become a weather watcher here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: family of tube shooting victim jean charles de menezes await court decision
text: the family of jean charles de menezes will learn the outcome of a court challenge over the decision not to bring charges over his death .

relatives of the brazilian took their case to the european court of human rights last year - almost a decade after he was mistaken for a suicide bomber and shot dead by police marksmen on a london tube train .
bedfordshire police 's chief constable jon boucher was a detective superintendent on the case that day .

documents.title: new plan drawn up for future of luton 's high town
text: plans for two public squares and up to 750 new homes have been laid out in a bold vision for the future of high town .
author: Luton News

documents.title: soulbury stone background
text: we 've been hearing plenty about the soulbury stone in buckinghamshire today , for which residents began a campaign when it seemed as though it may be moved after a motorist threatened to claim compensation after driving into it .
here are just a few of the more interesting points about the `` rolling stone ''
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lunchtime headlines : teenager killed in bike crash soulbury boulder wo n't be moved
text: the top stories this lunchtime :
author: Jon Kaye
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: 'vicious attack ' by teen gang in leighton buzzard
text: police are appealing for witnesses to what they have described as a `` vicious attack '' on a man by a gang of teenagers in leighton buzzard on sunday night .
it happened at around 20:45 near tesco at the corner of vimy road and leighton road .
passers-by stopped to help the man , and chase the gang away .
officers have described it as an `` unprovoked , brutal attack on an innocent stranger '' .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: campaign to save bucks community store gutted by fire
text: a campaign has been launched in buckinghamshire to help rebuild a community store recently gutted by a fire .
the group in hughenden valley , near high wycombe , have been quoted £ 18,000 to replace the structure and are appealing for help .
`` it 's the hub of the village and now it 's just gone .
many people are saying we 've lost the heart of the village , '' founder and manager louise jones said .
author: Ben Nye
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: 'rolling stone ' secure after car crash
text: 'rolling stone ' secure after car crash

documents.title: more than 200 crimes in bedfordshire children 's homes
text: bedfordshire police have recorded more than 200 crimes in children 's homes in the last three years , according to the howard league for penal reform .

the charity says the figures show youngsters are being criminalised at a higher rate than those in other types of care , and that staff at homes call the police over minor incidents that would n't come to officers ' attention if they happened in family homes .
in bedfordshire since 2012 there were 213 crimes reported .
in thames valley , which includes buckinghamshire , there were more than 600 reported .
the charity claims a child is almost six times as likely to be dealt with by the police than in any other type of care , and almost 20 times more likely than a child not in care .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather : showers later , with hail and thunder possible
text: while some areas may remain dry throughout the day , showers will develop later , with hail and thunder possible at times .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: fundraising page set up for decapitated hertford statue
text: a fundraising page has been set up to replace the stone head of 15 century printer william caxton , which was chopped off outside hertford antique shop beckwith and son .
author: Hertfordshire Mercury

documents.title: plans for bedford to cambridge rail link revealed
text: plans have been revealed for the bedford to cambridge rail link , with network rail saying its preferred route , from a list of 20 potential ones , is through sandy .
it 's part of the scheme to link oxford and cambridge - via milton keynes and bedford .
network rail wo n't publish its reasons for choosing this route until may , but says it 's looked at the costs , population and feasibility of each of the options .
we are yet to find out which communities will be affected .
author: Nicola Beckford
BBC Look East

documents.title: # jeffsmarch from luton to watford
text: yesterday , sports broadcaster jeff stelling completed his ninth marathon from luton to watford in as many days as part of his fundraising in aid of prostate cancer .

many football fans joined jeff 's march , including luton town 's chief executive gary sweet , who appeared to swiftly move away from rival teams ' mascot harry the hornet at their arrival at vicarage road last night !
today marks stelling 's final marathon to wembley stadium .
hugs all around as jeff , russ & supporters finish the penultimate marathon day of # jeffsmarch at @ twitterid
@ twitterid well done to all , especially russ .
best of luck for the final day and hope you all get the reception you deserve at the end .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

text: here are some of the things we 've been told about the soulbury stone :
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest headlines : boy killed in motorbike crash hemel kidnap investigation
text: the latest headlines :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: appeal after teen is killed in 'off-road ' motorbike crash
text: a teenage boy has been killed after his motorcycle hit a lamp post in luton yesterday .

bedfordshire police have said the boy was taken to luton and dunstable hospital in a critical condition following the crash on a pavement just off denham close shortly after 13:40 , but he later died .
the force has appealed for witnesses .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: faruk ali 'ca n't sleep at night ' , says brother
text: the brother of an autistic man from luton who believes he was assaulted by police officers says the incident has had `` a significant impact '' .

dhobir ali , giving evidence at a police misconduct hearing about events outside their family home in august 2014 , said his brother faruk now `` ca n't sleep at night '' and the `` routine he had was greatly disturbed '' .
`` i saw my brother come into the house - behind him was the officer .
i could see the fear , and i saw marks on his neck . ''
two officers were cleared of assault at luton crown court in december 2014 .
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: faruk ali police misconduct hearing : brother gives evidence
text: the second day of a misconduct hearing is under way in bedfordshire into the way two police officers treated an autistic man in luton , more than two years ago .
the officers , pcs christopher pitts from bedford and christopher thomas from welwyn garden city , have previously been found not guilty at luton crown court of assaulting faruk ali .
today , faruk ali 's brother dhobir is giving evidence .
i 'm at the hearing in wyboston and will bring you more on this throughout the day .
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: council says ancient stone 'will not be removed '
text: bucks county council has said an ancient stone in the village of soulbury , near leighton buzzard , will not be moved .
villagers started a campaign to save it after a driver backed into it damaging her car .
transport for buckinghamshire had told the leighton buzzard observer it `` may have to resort to removing it '' .
but councillor mark shaw told bbc three counties radio : `` it 's quite clear to move it , or even discuss moving it , which has never been on the agenda , would be absolute madness . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : problems on the west coast line
text: there 's a reduced service on london midland between london euston and milton keynes central due to a broken down train at bushey .
get the latest updates from bbc travel .
# bushey update 9 : services to/from # euston continue to be disrupted by the failed freight train .
all updates here :
@ twitterid planning to take the 12 20 from tamworth to euston .
how severe is the disruption ?
are we talking delays or full cancellation ?
@ twitterid on that line we 're taking about delays of up to 15 minutes , the service is scheduled to operate .
@ twitterid great stuff , thanks a lot for the reply !
@ twitterid no problem at all : o )
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: campaign to save ancient stone after driver claims compensation
text: a campaign to save an ancient stone in soulbury near leighton buzzard has begun after a driver backed into it and damaged her car .

as first reported in the leighton buzzard observer , the motorist is now threatening legal action , with bucks county council saying the stone , thought to have been located in chapel hill for millions of years , could be removed .

but parish council chairman victor wright told bbc three counties radio he and `` at least seven other people '' were prepared to chain themselves to the stone to save it : `` the village is enraged about this situation we will protest to the end . ''
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: bizarre ancient landmark in middle of road could be dug up after accident claim
text: a huge boulder which a road was bizarrely constructed around decades ago could finally be removed after a motorist crashed into it .
author: Leighton Buzzard Observer

text: today will be largely dry with some sunny spells , but with the chance of some heavy showers later .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 51f )
you can find a more detailed forecast where you live at bbc weather .

BBC Weather

documents.title: police investigate hemel hempstead kidnapping
text: police are investigating a kidnapping in hemel hempstead after a man was dragged out of his car in the rush hour on tuesday .
the 23-year-old was pulled from his vw golf into a waiting white van by four men just after 18:00 in belswains lane .
he was found about 45 minutes later near sainsbury 's at apsley , having sustained serious injuries .
hertfordshire police say the gang wore baseball caps , casual clothing and what appears to be distinctive blue surgical gloves .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: latest headlines : police investigate hemel kidnapping campaign to save ancient stone in soulbury
text: here are the top stories we 're looking at this morning :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: travel : accidents on m1 , a119 and m40
text: a bit out of our area , but this could affect you if you 're travelling north - two lanes are blocked on the northbound m1 between j15a for the a43 and j16 for the a45 at daventry due to a three-vehicle accident .
meanwhile , the a119 high road in waterford is closed southbound between the bramfield lane junction and the vicarage lane junction due to an accident involving two vehicles .
one lane is blocked on the london-bound m40 between j4 for the a404 at high wycombe and j3 for the a40 due to an accident involving a van .
get the latest updates from bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: welcome to local live for beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to today 's live page for the three counties where we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the area until 18:00 .
